intro: Onagra rubrinervis, commonly known as the red-veined onagra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins in its leaves, which contrast with its green foliage. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Onagra rubrinervis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
